channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump puts political goals above facts in CDC and Flynn dramas
Stories of missing bodies of Covid-19 victims reveal a city totally overwhelmed
item.description: When Flavio Ramos was wheeled into the hospital room, he was gasping for air and slipping in and out of consciousness. So it was his son, Arturo, who first noticed the bodies.

item.title: Hear from Covid-19 patient who had virus in December
item.description: Some of the first indications of Covid-19 in Europe seemed to hit in February. But a group of doctors in Paris have re-checked old samples and found that one patient they treated in December for pneumonia, actually had Covid-19. CNN's Melissa Bell speaks with that patient, Amirouche Hammar.

item.title: The people waiting out Covid-19 in dark, frozen Antarctica
item.description: While the rest of the world continues to grapple with the coronavirus pandemic, one continent has managed to remain entirely free of the infection.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Updates from around the world
One of Trump's personal valets has tested positive for coronavirus
Watch the entire CNN coronavirus town hall
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta host a global town hall answering your questions about what the future holds for the fight against Covid-19. Watch the full event below.

item.title: This is how hotels will change after Covid-19
item.description: Goodbye, breakfast buffets and bellhop service. Hello, temperature screening and keyless check-in.

item.title: Get ready for a campaign season full of China-Covid conspiracy theories
item.description: Attacking China has now become the centerpiece for the upcoming 2020 election campaign by an increasingly desperate Republican Party and its vulnerable leadership.

item.title: Trump's reaction when nurse says she lacks protective equipment
item.description: President Donald Trump disagreed with a nurse he was honoring in the Oval Office, insisting that he hadn't heard about personal protective equipment shortages in the US despite her account that PPE availability is "sporadic."

item.title: Engaged in December and married by May, coronavirus shaped our relationship ... and our wedding
item.description: "Can we take our masks off?" I ask, as my bride and I get into position.

item.title: Sheryl Sandberg: Women are burning out more than ever
item.description: The coronavirus and economic crises have had negative effects on everyone. But a new survey and its high-profile advocate — Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg — suggest women are being hit hardest by the increased pressures of work and home in the midst of this deadly pandemic.

item.title: Ibiza's nightlife is legendary. Covid-19 has crashed that party
item.description: This year, Ibiza's nightclubs were promoting the most famous names in house music - then Covid-19 arrived. CNN's Scott McLean reports on what the pandemic means for the Spanish party island.

item.title: An Albuquerque teen found $135K next to an ATM. Instead of walking away with it, he called police
item.description: Jose Nuñez Romaniz was on a mission to buy socks for his grandfather. He'd just helped him find the right ones online, after the elder man had no luck finding them in stores.

item.title: It's what I can't see in the Ahmaud Arbery shooting video that also terrifies me
item.description: It looks like every black man's nightmare.

item.title: The '10 plain truths' about the pandemic, according to a former CDC director
Mail carrier hilariously interrupts TikTok recording
item.description: Annette Desmond, a mail carrier for the US Postal Service, became a TikTok sensation after pulling up her truck right as neighbors Alexa Dinga and Collins Kitchens were about to record one of their TikTok dances.

item.title: Suspect in serial killings arrested in 29-year-old cold case
item.description: A former truck driver has been arrested in a Tennessee murder case from 1991 and in two similar cases in Wyoming the following year, officials said.

item.title: Grimes and Elon Musk's choice of baby name might not be accepted in California
item.description: Elon Musk and Grimes might have told fans their newborn baby boy is called X Æ A-12 Musk, but it seems the unusual moniker could fall foul of Californian state rules.

item.title: Man sentenced to death via Zoom
item.description: A man in Nigeria was sentenced to death via the popular video conferencing app Zoom this week, sparking condemnation from rights groups who described the ruling as inhumane.

item.title: How Merkel went from lame duck to global leader on coronavirus
People died where they fell as toxic gas escaped from chemical plant
item.description: Bodies lay crumpled on the ground beside toppled motorcycles and cars as suffocating toxic gas rose from a chemical plant in southern India in the early hours of Thursday morning.

item.title: ISIS seeks to exploit pandemic to mount resurgence in Iraq and Syria
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has forced the US-led military coalition battling ISIS to pause or suspend significant aspects of its campaign in Iraq and Syria, even as the terror group seeks to exploit the instability caused by the pandemic and a dramatic fall in oil prices.

item.title: Customer shot McDonald's employee after being told to leave due to virus restrictions
item.description: Two McDonald's employees in Oklahoma City were shot Wednesday after they told two customers to leave the store's dining area, police said.

item.title: This is what it's like to travel across Europe right now
item.description: From Athens to Brussels to London, CNN's International Diplomatic Editor Nic Robertson documents once familiar, now unusual, travel across Europe during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: India's Jio Platforms lands $1.5 billion from Vista Equity
item.description: Another week brings another massive injection of cash for India's biggest tech and telecom firm.

item.title: Coronavirus found in men's semen
item.description: The new coronavirus can persist in men's semen even after they have begun to recover, a finding that raises the possibility the virus could be sexually transmitted, Chinese researchers said Thursday.

item.title: This restaurant in Amsterdam introduced 'quarantine greenhouses' so diners can eat while social distancing
item.description: Missing restaurants while social distancing? You're not alone. One restaurant in the Netherlands, though, has found a solution.

item.title: Tens of thousands of crew members still stuck on cruise ships
item.description: Most cruise passengers have made their way back home, and the vast ships that once ferried them from port to port are moored up or back on the water, relocating for the next stage in their journeys.

item.title: Woman jailed for opening salon amid lockdown. See what she told judge
item.description: Dallas salon owner Shelly Luther was sentenced to 7 days in jail after refusing to close her salon despite statewide stay-at-home orders.

item.title: Alphabet gives up its plan to build a futuristic neighborhood in Toronto
item.description: Google's parent company is abandoning a controversial plan to turn Toronto's waterfront into a futuristic neighborhood.

item.title: The UK economy is heading for its worst crash in 300 years
Michael Jordan's children reveal the extent of their dad's competitive streak
item.description: From superior athleticism to his tireless work ethic, there are many contributing factors that make Michael Jordan one of the greatest basketball players of all time.

item.title: Asteroids don't just go rogue and head for the sun. But this one apparently did
item.description: When the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency's Hayabusa2 spacecraft briefly touched down on near-Earth asteroid Ryugu, scientists noticed two different colors of material on the asteroid's surface.

item.title: Malia Obama makes rare appearance in documentary
item.description: Former first daughter Malia Obama makes a rare appearance on Michelle Obama's Netflix documentary, where she gets emotional after seeing the crowd for her mom's book tour.

item.title: Gollum actor Andy Serkis to read entire 'Hobbit' live online for charities
item.description: Actor and director Andy Serkis will read the entire J.R.R. Tolkien novel "The Hobbit" out loud in one marathon sitting on Friday to raise money for charities supporting the UK's National Health Service (NHS).

item.title: Banksy donates new artwork honoring health care workers to hospital
item.description: Street artist Banksy unveiled a new artwork honoring health care workers that he donated to the University Hospital Southampton (UHS) in the UK.

item.title: Video shows man shoving Texas park ranger into a lake
item.description: A man in Austin, Texas, has been arrested and charged after shoving a park ranger into a lake while the ranger was trying to get a group of people to practice social distancing.

item.title: Understanding the rare condition that makes people want to amputate their own limbs
item.description: For some, the universal human desire for wholeness may only be fulfilled by an act of excision.

item.title: Struggling with migraines? This specific yoga routine can help
item.description: Waking up with a slight headache that becomes painful enough to hinder daily life is the experience of many who suffer from migraines.

item.title: Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher play 'voice swap'
item.description: Actress Mila Kunis tries hard to hold it together with husband Ashton Kutcher as they mouth out what the other is saying on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon."

item.title: How Australia could harness its tides for energy
item.description: Australia is famous for its beaches and exhilarating surf. But the ocean offers more than just a surfer's paradise: its tides are also a source of renewable energy.

item.title: The artists manipulating cities into works of 'architectural fiction'
item.description: Architects are -- sometimes to their dismay -- confined by the limits of engineering. In turn, engineers are confined by the limits of physics.

item.title: A manicure amateur attempts nail art at home. The results are not good
item.description: A few weeks into the coronavirus lockdown, it became apparent that our new circumstances would change the way we looked.

item.title: Dad freaks out over 4-year-old son's first home run
item.description: A Georgia dad jumped in the air with excitement after his four-year-old son hit his first home run.

item.title: CDC and Flynn dramas show how US President disdains government structures meant to dispense independent and fact-based policymaking
item.description: President Donald Trump has spent three years discrediting and sidelining institutional sources of facts, truth and trust that threaten his political and personal goals.

item.title: Trump administration rejects CDC guidance on reopening
item.description: • White House becomes ground zero for culture war over face masks • Opinion: Retired US general tells Trump how to take charge of this crisis

item.title: 3-point plan to reopen Australia
Dr. Gupta's tips on how to safely shop at grocery stores
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta demonstrates how to grocery shop safely as Americans adjust to a new way of life during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 75,000 Americans at risk of dying from virus 'despair,' group warns
